rule1: a. Briefly describe your experiment and its purpose.
rule2: b. Identify any sensitive information or variables that need to remain blinded.

rule1: a. How will you ensure that participants are unaware of the experimental conditions?
rule2: b. Describe your informed consent process and how it maintains blinding.

rule1: a. How will you randomize participants into different groups or conditions?
rule2: b. What steps will you take to prevent accidental unmasking during allocation?

rule1: a. Specify who collects data and how they remain blinded.
rule2: b. Detail any precautions to prevent inadvertent unmasking during data collection.

rule1: a. How will you analyze the data while maintaining blinding?
rule2: b. Consider statistical methods or procedures that minimize unmasking.

rule1: a. Describe how you will summarize and present results without revealing group assignments.
rule2: b. Address any challenges related to unmasking during result dissemination.

rule1: a. Regularly assess whether blinding procedures are being followed.
rule2: b. Encourage team members to reflect on potential risks of unmasking.
